title: How to Make a Full Paper Tulip

steps.title: Fold the 8" x 11" (20cm x 28cm) paper to turn it into a triangle.
steps.content: Fold the 8" x 11" (20cm x 28cm) paper to turn it into a triangle.

steps.title: Cut off the excess piece of paper out created by the fold.
steps.content: Cut off the excess piece of paper out created by the fold. Put it aside (you'll need it later). You should be left with a right triangle.

steps.title: Unfold the triangle and fold it the opposite way.
steps.content: Unfold the triangle and fold it the opposite way. You should have a square piece of paper with an 'X' across it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Crease the folds so that the middle of the 'X' is pointing up.
steps.content: Crease the folds so that the middle of the 'X' is pointing up.

steps.title: Fold the bottom piece of paper up to meet at the top.
steps.content: Fold the bottom piece of paper up to meet at the top.

steps.title: Unfold the paper.
steps.content: Unfold the paper. Fold the sides together and unfold again. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Put the sides together.
steps.content: Put the sides together.

steps.title: Flatten it down.
steps.content: Flatten it down.

steps.title: Turn the triangle upside down.
steps.content: Turn the triangle upside down.

steps.title: Fold the flaps down to meet at the corner.
steps.content: Fold the flaps down to meet at the corner.

steps.title: Turn the paper over and do the same thing on the other side.
steps.content: Turn the paper over and do the same thing on the other side.

steps.title: Turn a flap over to the right.
steps.content: Turn a flap over to the right. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Flip the paper over and turn a flap over to the right again.
steps.content: Flip the paper over and turn a flap over to the right again. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Take the opposite ends of the flap and insert one corner of a flap into the other flap.
steps.content: Take the opposite ends of the flap and insert one corner of a flap into the other flap. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Flatten it down and repeat on the other side.
steps.content: Flatten it down and repeat on the other side.

steps.title: Hold it with index fingers inside the folded flaps and thumbs supporting the outside.
steps.content: Hold it with index fingers inside the folded flaps and thumbs supporting the outside. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Blow into the hole facing you, while tugging on the folded flaps to let air in.
steps.content: Blow into the hole facing you, while tugging on the folded flaps to let air in. If the paper won't fill with air you may have to stick a pencil in the hole and push the sides out. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Fold or curl the petals down with a pencil or pen.
steps.content: Fold or curl the petals down with a pencil or pen.

steps.title: Put the tulip head aside and grab the excess piece of paper cut off earlier.
steps.content: Put the tulip head aside and grab the excess piece of paper cut off earlier.

steps.title: Fold this piece of paper lengthwise three times.
steps.content: Fold this piece of paper lengthwise three times. This creates the tulip's stem.

steps.title: Insert the stem into the hole in the tulip head.
steps.content: Insert the stem into the hole in the tulip head.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.
